message:
@ericflo, @leah - I'm getting close to feature complete on implementing an API client.  This brings me to see which pieces are NOT available in the API, and I was wondering if there was a roadmap.  

* requests
* search
* list or filter groups you're NOT in (to join)
*** a roadmap that you'd like to make public :-)
I'd like to add user stats to that list, the public ones you see upon clicking a person's name in the grey box like area; stars given/recieved, topics created, messages posted etc etc
As the site matures and as we grow, we'll have to get more formal about this stuff, but for now we're keepin' it real.
@ericflo from my perspective, finding groups that you're not alredy in would be cool.  Like "where'd the pycon group"  right now, your only option from the api is "make a new pycon group"

@issackelly I could lie and say we had some big roadmap, but we just don't.  Our roadmap is, if you guys ask for stuff, we'll do it.  (Depending on importance of the request, and the time it'll take to implement it vs. fixing things on the real site, of course)
Agreed @issackelly that's not ideal at all
Let me look into it
There are no limit/offset pagination bits for any of the discovers yet
Sorry :(
The thing is we don't have pagination yet anywhere really, I want to make sure we do it in a consistent way.

Ok, so I'm writing up the docs right now, but there are a few more endpoints:
^groups/discover/friend.json
^groups/discover/explore/(?P<angle>popular|recent|alphabetical).json
^groups/discover/category.json
^groups/discover/category/(?P<category>[\w-]+).json
^groups/discover/search.json
^groups/(?P<group_id>\d+)/join.json
^groups/(?P<group_id>\d+)/request.json
I can't believe we didn't have an API for joining groups before :)

Ok, signing out for a while.  I'll be back on later tonight.

Sorry, the answer to the first question is nope, but the answer to the second question is POST
@ericflo is the fact that fetching topics (and I assume messages) for a group you don't belong to results in {"error": "You are not a member of this group."} a policy or an oversight?
@protocool Oversight.  The API was built before we had public groups.  I'll fix it now, so that if the group is public you can get the data.
